isis.stitle: TSI 01-06-03 - Offset phasing of interaxle propeller shafts on Dana Spicer (formerly Eaton) axles

subjectgroup.subject: Offset phasing of interaxle propeller shafts on Dana Spicer (formerly Eaton) axles

geninfo.para: Interaxle propeller shaft phasing on certain Dana Spicer tandem axles has been changed in order to minimize driveline torsional activity feedback to Allison and Eaton (Fuller) transmissions.

item.para: On Dana SPL170 propeller shafts, while looking from the front to the rear of the interaxle assembly, the rear portion is rotated approximately 32 degrees (3 teeth) counterclockwise from the normal 0 degree phasing. NOTE: Slip joint is sealed and should not be disassembled.

On Dana 10 Series propeller shafts, while looking from the front to the rear of the interaxle assembly, the rear portion is rotated approximately 22 degrees (1 tooth) counterclockwise from the normal 0 degreephasing.

Offset interaxle propeller shafts have part numbers with an "F" in the 6th position. Typical part numbers are: 270DTF, 427DTF, 217STF, 417STF, 217LTF, 417LTF. NOTE: Part number labels are attached to the propeller shafts. It may be necessary to remove paint from the label in order to read it.
When servicing propeller shafts, it is strongly recommended that paint alignment stripes be added to the shaft before disassembly.
